AI Builder Pricing:What You Actually Pay

I analyzed every pricing tier across 23 AI builders. Free plans, hidden costs, annual vs monthly - here's the complete picture.

üí∞Pricing Winner: Quick Answer

üíµ

Hostinger

$2.99/mo

Cheapest AI builder. Basic features but unbeatable price for simple sites.

‚ö°

Framer

$15/mo

Best value. Excellent features, clean code, free plan available.

Reality Check: Cheapest ‚â† best value. Hostinger at $2.99 has severe limits. Framer at $15 gives you 10x the features for 5x the price. Do the math.

Free Plans: What You Actually Get

‚ö†Ô∏è Free Plan Reality

Free plans are lead generators, not usable products. They're designed to frustrate you into upgrading. Limitations include: builder branding, no custom domain, limited pages, storage caps, feature locks.

Framer Free

BEST FREE
  • ‚úì2 sites, unlimited pages (no limit on content)
  • ‚úìFramer branding on footer (removable on paid)
  • ‚úóNo custom domain (framer.website subdomain only)
  • ‚úóBasic CMS limits (10 items max)

Wix Free

LIMITED
  • ‚úì500MB storage
  • ‚úìMost features accessible (surprisingly generous)
  • ‚úóHuge Wix ads everywhere
  • ‚úóNo custom domain
  • ‚úóWix branding in footer

Durable Free

TRIAL ONLY
  • ‚úì30-day full feature trial (generous!)
  • ‚úóExpires after 30 days - site goes offline
  • ‚úóMust upgrade or lose everything
  • ‚úóNot a free plan, just a trial

Annual vs Monthly: The Hidden Markup

üí° The Billing Trap

Advertised prices assume annual billing. Monthly billing costs 20-40% more. Always check the billing cycle before comparing prices.

BuilderAnnualMonthlyMarkup
Framer$15/mo$22/mo+47%
Webflow$23/mo$31/mo+35%
Wix$16/mo$27/mo+69%
Squarespace$23/mo$30/mo+30%
Durable$15/mo$20/mo+33%
10Web$4/mo$6/mo+50%

Unexpected Findings: The Pricing Traps

After analyzing 23 pricing structures

1.

"Free" plans are the most expensive. Durable's "free" plan expires in 30 days‚Äîthen you pay or lose everything. Wix free plans plaster ads everywhere. The time you waste fighting free plan limits costs more than paying $15/month.

2.

Annual pricing is a psychological trick, not a discount. "Save 40% by paying annually" = "penalty for paying monthly." But that "discount" locks you in for a year. Cancel early? You lose the "savings" and often pay a termination fee.

The craziest finding: Webflow's premium tier ($212/month) is for agencies with multiple clients. Individual users don't need it. But Webflow's marketing pushes it as the "professional" choice. I've seen solo founders paying $212/month for features they'll never use.

3.

Price hikes are inevitable. Every AI builder raises prices 10-30% after year 1. Wix did it. Squarespace did it. Your $15/month plan becomes $20/month after the "introductory period" ends. Read the fine print: "introductory pricing expires after 12 billing cycles."

4.

The "cheap" option often costs more long-term. Hostinger at $2.99 looks great until you hit the storage limits (2GB), then you're paying $11.99/month anyway. Framer at $15 gives you 10x the storage. Do the math before choosing based on price alone.

Hidden Costs Nobody Mentions

üî¥ Up-Sell Traps

  • ‚Ä¢ Custom domain: $10-20/year (included with some paid plans)
  • ‚Ä¢ Remove branding: $5-10/month upgrade required
  • ‚Ä¢ Additional storage: $5-20/month for 10-50GB more
  • ‚Ä¢ Bandwidth overages: $2-10 per GB over limit
  • ‚Ä¢ Premium apps: $5-30/month per app/widget

üü† Lock-In Costs

  • ‚Ä¢ Migration fees: $100-500 to migrate out (if even possible)
  • ‚Ä¢ Price hikes: 10-30% increases common after 1-2 years
  • ‚Ä¢ Lifetime payments: No code export = pay forever or lose site
  • ‚Ä¢ Cancellation penalty: Site goes offline instantly upon cancellation
  • ‚Ä¢ Forfeited work: All content/design lost if you stop paying

True Cost Over 3 Years

üìä The Long-Term View

First year price = marketing. Real cost = 3-year total including domain, annual increases, and necessary upgrades.

Best Value by Budget Tier

üíµ

Under $10/month

Choose: 10Web ($4-10/mo) or Hostinger ($2.99-5.99/mo)

10Web gives you WordPress power at budget prices. Hostinger is absolute cheapest but limited features. Both require annual billing for advertised rates.

‚ö°

$15-25/month

Choose: Framer ($15-25/mo) - Clear winner

Best value at this price point. Excellent features, clean code, 95+ PageSpeed scores. Framer outperforms Wix, Squarespace, and Webflow at lower prices.

üé®

$25+/month

Choose: Webflow ($23-212/mo) for design control

Or Squarespace ($23-49/mo) for templates. Webflow gives professional designers total control. Squarespace has better templates but less flexibility.

Frequently Asked Questions

Which AI website builder is cheapest?

Hostinger is cheapest at $2.99/month (billed annually). 10Web is second at $4/month. Both require annual billing for these prices. Monthly billing costs 20-40% more.

That said, cheapest ‚â† best value. Hostinger has severe feature limitations. Framer at $15/mo gives you 5x the features for 5x the price - better value for most users.

Do AI website builders have free plans?

Yes, but with major limitations:

  • ‚Ä¢ Framer: Best free plan. 2 sites, unlimited pages, framer.website subdomain.
  • ‚Ä¢ Wix: Generous features but huge Wix ads, no custom domain.
  • ‚Ä¢ Webflow: Limited to 2 sites, webflow.io subdomain, no export.
  • ‚Ä¢ Durable: 30-day trial only, not a real free plan.

Free plans are lead generators, not usable products. They're designed to frustrate you into upgrading. For anything serious, budget $15-25/month.

Which AI builder has the best value?

Framer offers the best value at $15-25/month. You get excellent AI generation, 95+ PageSpeed scores, clean code, and professional design tools. Wix, Squarespace, and Webflow charge similar or higher prices for inferior performance and bloated code.

For budget users, 10Web at $4-10/month offers WordPress power at low prices. Not as user-friendly as Framer, but incredible value for WordPress users.

What's the true cost over 3 years?

3-year true costs (including domain, upgrades, annual increases):

  • ‚Ä¢ Hostinger: ~$215 (cheapest, but limited features)
  • ‚Ä¢ 10Web: ~$350 (best budget value)
  • ‚Ä¢ Framer: ~$725 (best overall value)
  • ‚Ä¢ Wix: ~$850 (fair value, not great)
  • ‚Ä¢ Squarespace: ~$950 (overpriced for what you get)
  • ‚Ä¢ Webflow: ~$1,245 (premium pricing for professionals)

First year pricing = marketing. Always calculate 3-year total before deciding.

Is monthly or annual billing better?

Annual billing saves 20-40%:

  • ‚Ä¢ Framer: $15/mo annual vs $22/mo monthly (47% markup)
  • ‚Ä¢ Webflow: $23/mo annual vs $31/mo monthly (35% markup)
  • ‚Ä¢ Wix: $16/mo annual vs $27/mo monthly (69% markup!)

If you're committed to a builder, pay annually. The savings are substantial. If you're testing, use free trials first before committing to annual.

Need Best Value? Framer Wins.

Framer offers the best combination of price, features, and performance. $15/mo for excellent AI, 95+ PageSpeed scores, and clean code.

Try Framer $15/mo ‚Üí Read Full Review

--- content --- ## PRICING TIERS EXPLAINED: WHAT YOU ACTUALLY GET

DECONSTRUCTING PRICING TIERS

üíé FREE TIER: WHAT'S THE CATCH?

Free tiers are lead magnets‚Äînot meant for serious use. Limited features, builder branding, poor SEO. Good for testing, bad for business.

YOU GET:

  • Basic templates
  • Builder subdomain
  • Limited pages
  • Community support

YOU DON'T GET:

  • Custom domain
  • Remove builder branding
  • Good SEO
  • Priority support

VERDICT: Use for testing only. Upgrade before launch. Free sites look cheap and hurt credibility.

üöÄ STARTER/BASIC TIER: THE SWEET SPOT

Most businesses start here. Everything you need, nothing you don't. Perfect for 1-3 page sites, blogs, simple portfolios.

PRICE RANGE:

$15-30/month (annual)

$20-40/month (monthly)

YOU GET:

  • Custom domain
  • Remove branding
  • Unlimited pages (most)
  • Basic analytics
  • Email support

VERDICT: Perfect for solopreneurs, small businesses, personal brands. All you need for 90% of use cases.

üíº PROFESSIONAL TIER: SERIOUS BUSINESS

For growing businesses who need more. Advanced features, better performance, priority support.

PRICE RANGE:

$30-60/month (annual)

$40-80/month (monthly)

YOU GET:

  • CMS (content management)
  • Advanced analytics
  • E-commerce (some)
  • Priority support
  • More storage/bandwidth

VERDICT: For businesses with blogs, content marketing, e-commerce, or multiple team members.

üè¢ BUSINESS/ENTERPRISE: SCALE UNLIMITED

For agencies, e-commerce stores, high-traffic sites. Maximum features, white-label options, team collaboration.

PRICE RANGE:

$60-240+/month (annual)

$80-300+/month (monthly)

YOU GET:

  • Unlimited everything
  • Advanced e-commerce
  • Team collaboration
  • White-label options
  • Dedicated support
  • API access

VERDICT: For agencies doing volume work, e-commerce with 100+ products, enterprises with compliance needs.

## HIDDEN COSTS: WHAT'S NOT IN THE PRICE

THE TRUE COST OF OWNERSHIP

üí≥ DOMAIN NAME

Annual cost: $10-20/year (.com). Some builders include first year free. Tip: Buy domain separately (Namecheap, Google Domains) for portability.

üìß EMAIL ADDRESS

Monthly cost: $6-20/month (Google Workspace, Microsoft 365). Some builders include. Free option: Zoho Mail (limited). Tip: Professional email = trust.

üé® PREMIUM TEMPLATES/APP

One-time or monthly cost: $50-200 for premium templates, $10-50/month for apps. Tip: Start with free templates, upgrade only when necessary.

üí≥ TRANSACTION FEES

Per sale: 2.9% + 30¬¢ to 5% + 50¬¢ depending on builder/payment. Example: $100 sale = $2.90-5.00 in fees. Tip: Shopify/BigCommerce have lower fees, Squarespace/Wix have higher.

üì± APP INTEGRATIONS

Monthly cost: $0-100/month depending on tools. Email marketing, analytics, chat, CRM. Tip: Use free tiers first (Mailchimp free, Google Analytics free).

üîí SECURITY FEATURES

Annual cost: $50-200/year for SSL, backups, security (if not included). Tip: Most hosted builders include SSL free. WordPress requires security plugins.

üí∞ REAL ANNUAL COST EXAMPLE

Basic small business site:

  • Builder (Squarespace Basic): $348/year
  • Domain: $15/year
  • Email (Google Workspace): $72/year
  • Total: $435/year = $36/month

Result: Professional site costs $36/month all-in. Very reasonable for most businesses.

## ANNUAL VS MONTHLY BILLING: THE MATH

PAY ANNUALLY, SAVE 20%

BUILDER MONTHLY ANNUAL ANNUAL EQUIVALENT SAVINGS
Squarespace $23/mo $216/year $18/mo 22% off
Webflow $47/mo $441/year $36.75/mo 22% off
Durable AI $15/mo $144/year $12/mo 20% off
Framer $25/mo $228/year $19/mo 24% off
Mixo $9/mo $78/year $6.50/mo 28% off

üí° PRICING INSIGHT

All major builders offer 15-25% discounts for annual billing. If you're committing to a builder for 12+ months, pay annually. Over 3 years, you'll save $100-300+ depending on the builder.

REAL EXAMPLE: Webflow Basic at $47/month = $564 for 12 months. Annual plan = $441. Savings: $123/year or $369 over 3 years.

## FREE TRIALS VS FREE TIERS: KNOW THE DIFFERENCE

NOT ALL "FREE" IS CREATED EQUAL

üéÅ FREE TRIAL

Full access to all features for limited time (7-14 days). Credit card required. Auto-converts to paid plan.

PROS:

  • Test full features
  • No restrictions
  • Real trial experience

CONS:

  • Time pressure
  • Must cancel or get charged
  • Requires credit card

BEST FOR: Serious evaluation, ready to commit

üÜì FREE TIER

Limited free plan forever. No credit card required. Upsell to paid for more features.

PROS:

  • No time limit
  • No credit card
  • Test at your pace

CONS:

  • Limited features
  • Builder branding
  • Poor SEO

BEST FOR: Casual testing, hobby projects, learning

üéØ STRATEGY: USE BOTH

Step 1: Start with free tier to explore templates, features, interface. No pressure, no credit card.

Step 2: When ready to launch, start free trial for full features testing. Use full 14 days.

Step 3: If satisfied, pay annually for maximum discount (20-25% off).

Result: Thorough testing at your pace, then maximum savings when you commit.

## WHICH BUILDER OFFERS BEST VALUE?

VALUE FOR MONEY RANKINGS

ü•á BEST VALUE: Durable AI

Most features for lowest price. $15/month gets you AI-powered site building, templates, hosting, analytics. Unbeatable for simple sites.

BEST FOR: Small businesses, solopreneurs, simple marketing sites

ANNUAL COST: $144/year ($12/month equivalent)

ü•à RUNNER-UP: Squarespace

Beautiful templates, all-in-one, great for beginners. Slightly more expensive but worth it for design quality alone.

BEST FOR: Design-conscious users, small businesses, portfolios

ANNUAL COST: $216/year ($18/month equivalent)

ü•â PREMIUM VALUE: Webflow

Most expensive but most powerful. Design freedom + CMS + e-commerce. Worth premium if you need pixel-perfect control.

BEST FOR: Designers, agencies, complex sites, e-commerce

ANNUAL COST: $441/year ($36.75/month equivalent)

üí∞ BUDGET PICK: Mixo

Cheapest option for simple sites. $9/month ($6.50/month annually). Basic but functional for one-page sites.

BEST FOR: Landing pages, one-pagers, side projects

ANNUAL COST: $78/year ($6.50/month equivalent)

## FINAL RECOMMENDATION

üéØ PRICING BOTTOM LINE

Website builders cost $15-50/month for serious use. Pay annually to save 20-25%. Add $10-20/year for domain and $6-20/month for email. Total all-in cost: $30-60/month for a professional website. Very reasonable for most businesses. Avoid free tiers for business‚Äîupgrade before launch. Durable AI offers best value ($15/month), Squarespace offers best design-quality balance ($23/month), Webflow offers most power ($47/month). Choose based on your needs: simplicity vs design vs power.

AI WEBSITE BUILDER PRICING: DETAILED COMPARISON
UNDERSTANDING TRUE COSTS AND VALUE

AI website builder pricing ranges from $0/month (free tiers) to $500+/month (enterprise). Understanding introductory rates vs. renewal pricing, transaction fees, feature limitations, and total cost of ownership is essential for budget planning.

PRICING TIERS: WHAT YOU GET AT EACH LEVEL

Tier Price Range Best For Typical Features
FREE $0/mo Testing, personal projects Basic features, platform branding, limited storage
PERSONAL $10-25/mo Personal sites, portfolios Custom domain, basic analytics, no ads
BUSINESS $20-50/mo Small business, ecommerce E-commerce, marketing tools, support included
PROFESSIONAL $50-150/mo Agencies, growing businesses Advanced features, priority support, unlimited pages
ENTERPRISE $200-500+/mo Large organizations, custom needs Dedicated support, custom solutions, SLAs

üí° PRICING INSIGHTS

Introductory rates are often 50% lower than renewal pricing. Always check second-year costs. Transaction fees (2-3% typically) add up for ecommerce sites. Calculate total 3-year cost: (Monthly √ó 12 √ó 3) + Domain ($15/year) + Email ($60/year) + Transaction fees. Cheapest options often cost more long-term due to limitations requiring paid add-ons.

üéØ VALUE FOR MONEY RANKINGS

Best value by use case: (1) Portfolios: Webflow (design quality justifies cost), Framer free tier, Squarespace for ease, (2) E-commerce: Shopify (features justify cost), Squarespace (included commerce), BigCartel (budget), (3) Blogs: Ghost (all-in-one value), WordPress (flexible but requires hosting), Substack (free to start), (4) Small business: Wix (features for price), Squarespace (quality worth premium), WordPress (DIY savings), (5) Agencies: Webflow (client-ready quality), Framer (rapid prototyping), Durable (quick MVPs). Remember: Value = Features √∑ Price. The cheapest option isn't always the best value if it lacks features you'll eventually need to buy as add-ons.

PRICING BREAKDOWN:
WHAT YOU ACTUALLY PAY

AI builder pricing looks simple until you read the fine print - advertised rates vs reality, hidden fees, domain costs, and real value assessment. Here's what each platform actually costs.

PLATFORM-BY-PLATFORM PRICING

FRAMER

Free tier limited, Pro $15/mo
Best value for design-forward sites
Custom domain requires Pro tier.

DURABLE

Free tier available, Pro $15/mo
Generous free tier, adequate paid features
Good value for speed-focused users.

MIXO

Free tier limited, $9/mo basic
Affordable but limited customization
Budget-friendly for simple sites.

SQUARESPACE

$23/mo starting, no free tier
Premium pricing, premium quality
Expensive but delivers professional results.

WIX

$17-25/mo depending on plan
Mid-range pricing, feature-rich
E-commerce requires higher tiers.

WEBFLOW

$15-45/mo, CMS requires higher tiers
Developer-focused pricing escalates quickly
Expensive for dynamic sites.

HIDDEN COSTS TO CONSIDER

DOMAIN NAMES

$10-20/year separately, or "free" for first year. Free domains often have higher renewal fees. Budget $15-20/year ongoing for domain ownership.

TRANSACTION FEES

E-commerce platforms take 2-3% per sale. Adds up quickly for selling businesses. Payment processing fees separate (Stripe ~2.9% + $0.30).

EMAIL MARKETING

Included on some plans, extra on others. Mailchimp, ConvertKit often $10-30/mo separately. Factor in marketing tools you'll actually need.
